sect1.title: Building Zorba
sect1.para: Once you have successfully configured your Zorba build (as described in Configuring a Zorba Build Using CMake), you should now be able to build the project.

listitem.para: For Makefile-based builds, just type make (or makej2 to do a parallel build on a multi-core machine) from inside the {ZORBABUILD} directory.
For IDE-based builds, open the project created in the previous step and build the ALL target.

sect1.para: The build will take some time. If it finishes successfully, you're ready to install and run Zorba.

sect1.title: Installing Zorba

listitem.para: For Makefile-based builds, just type makeinstall . There is also a makeuninstall target.
For IDE-based builds, invoke the INSTALL project.

sect1.para: In either case, Zorba will be installed into the location specified by the CMake configuration parameter CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX, as described in Configuration Parameters (the -D arguments).

sect1.title: Setting the PATH
sect1.para: In order for users on your system to use Zorba, the bin/ subdirectory of your installation directory must be on their path.

sect1.title: Help!
sect1.para: If you have any problems building or running Zorba, contact the zorba-users mailing list. Sign up and see other instructions at https://groups.google.com/forum/?hl=en&fromgroups#!forum/zorba-users .
